A Book Example Using bookdown Frida Gomam 2018-05-16 Preface Hi there, this is my great book. Why read this book It is very important… Structure of the book Chapters ?? introduces a new topic, and … Software information and conventions I used the knitr package (Xie 2015) and the bookdown package (Xie 2018) to compile my book. My R session information is shown below: sessionInfo() ## R version 3.4.2 (2017-09-28) ## Platform: x86_64-apple-darwin15.6.0 (64-bit) ## Running under: macOS High Sierra 10.13.2 ## ## Matrix products: default ## BLAS: /System/Library/Frameworks/Accelerate.framework/Versions/A/Frameworks/vecLib.framework/Versions/A/libBLAS.dylib ## LAPACK: /Library/Frameworks/R.framework/Versions/3.4/Resources/lib/libRlapack.dylib ## ## locale: ## [1] en_US.UTF-8/en_US.UTF-8/en_US.UTF-8/C/en_US.UTF-8/en_US.UTF-8 ## ## attached base packages: ## [1] stats graphics grDevices utils datasets ## [6] methods base ## ## loaded via a namespace (and not attached): ## [1] Rcpp_0.12.16 bookdown_0.7.10 digest_0.6.15 ## [4] rprojroot_1.2 mime_0.5 backports_1.1.1 ## [7] magrittr_1.5 evaluate_0.10.1 highr_0.6 ## [10] stringi_1.1.7 rstudioapi_0.7 rmarkdown_1.9 ## [13] tools_3.4.2 servr_0.9 stringr_1.3.0 ## [16] httpuv_1.3.6.2 xfun_0.1 yaml_2.1.18 ## [19] compiler_3.4.2 htmltools_0.3.6 knitr_1.20 Package names are in bold text (e.g., rmarkdown), and inline code and filenames are formatted in a typewriter font (e.g., knitr::knit('foo.Rmd')). Function names are followed by parentheses (e.g., bookdown::render_book()). Acknowledgments A lot of people helped me when I was writing the book. Frida Gomam on the Mars References
